solaris.name: The Solar Covenant
solaris.description: Worship of the Eternal Sun ‚Äî the oldest surviving faith. Temples face east, and adherents mark holy days at dawn.

tidemother.name: Faith of the Tidemother
tidemother.description: Seafarers' faith centred on the Tidemother ‚Äî goddess of currents, storms, and safe harbour.

earthroot.name: The Earthroot Communion
earthroot.description: Nature worship venerating the world-tree whose roots bind all living things. Shrines stand in forest glades.

ironfaith.name: The Iron Creed
ironfaith.description: Born among mountain clans, the Iron Creed teaches that the soul is forged through trial and labour.

starseers.name: Order of the Starseers
starseers.description: Mystic scholar-monks who chart the heavens and claim to read fate in the constellations.

stoneheart.name: The Stoneheart Pact
stoneheart.description: Mountain-dwellers who believe the gods sleep inside stone and that every carved hall is a prayer.

serpentway.name: The Serpent's Way
serpentway.description: Swamp mystics who worship the Great Serpent ‚Äî symbol of death, rebirth, and the cycle of decay and renewal.

arcanum.name: The Arcane Orthodoxy
arcanum.description: Less a religion than a philosophical order ‚Äî practitioners believe magic itself is divine and study is worship.

stormfather.name: Cult of the Stormfather
stormfather.description: Northern raiders worship the Stormfather ‚Äî god of thunder, war, and the open sea. Sacrifices are made before raids.

dunewalkers.name: The Dunewalker Creed
dunewalkers.description: Desert faith teaching that the gods test mortals with heat and thirst. Water-sharing is the holiest act.

dreamweavers.name: The Dreamweaver Circle
dreamweavers.description: Practitioners enter dream-trances to commune with spirits. They believe waking life is the lesser reality.

ashwalkers.name: The Ashwalker Path
ashwalkers.description: Fire-worshippers who practised ritual immolation. Suppressed after the Great Pyre Rebellion of 230.

voidcallers.name: The Cult of the Void
voidcallers.description: An esoteric cult that worshipped the emptiness between stars. Banned after the Mindbreak Plague of 400.

bonesingers.name: The Bonesinger Rites
bonesingers.description: Ancestor-worship tradition where the dead were preserved and "sang" through wind-harps atop burial spires. Faded after prolonged plague.

flameheralds.name: Heralds of the Eternal Flame
flameheralds.description: A militant offshoot of the Solar Covenant. Launched three crusades before collapsing into internal schism.

bloodmoon.name: The Blood Moon Covenant
bloodmoon.description: Blood-sacrifice cult that performed rituals under the red moon. Eradicated by a combined crusade of the Solar Covenant and Iron Creed.

silentorder.name: The Silent Order
silentorder.description: Monks who took vows of eternal silence, believing all speech corrupted divine truth. Died out when no new followers could be recruited.

holySiteTypes.name: Sacred Spring
holySiteTypes.description: Blessed waters said to cure ailments

holySiteTypes.name: World-Tree Sapling
holySiteTypes.description: A sapling of the legendary world-tree

holySiteTypes.name: Grand Reliquary
holySiteTypes.description: Repository of sacred relics from many faiths

holySiteTypes.name: Dragon Bone Shrine
holySiteTypes.description: Shrine built around the petrified bones of an ancient dragon

holySiteTypes.name: Crystal Cavern
holySiteTypes.description: Underground cavern where crystals hum with divine resonance

holySiteTypes.name: Storm Peak Altar
holySiteTypes.description: Mountain summit where lightning strikes are divine omens

holySiteTypes.name: Sunken Temple
holySiteTypes.description: Half-submerged ruins of an ancient temple to forgotten gods

holySiteTypes.name: Oasis Shrine
holySiteTypes.description: Desert oasis believed to have been created by divine intervention

holySiteTypes.name: Moonwell
holySiteTypes.description: A still pool that reflects the stars even during daylight

holySiteTypes.name: The Blood Stone
holySiteTypes.description: A crimson megalith that seems to pulse with inner warmth

heresies.name: Dualist Heresy
heresies.description: Claims the divine has both a light and dark aspect, equal in power

heresies.name: Iconoclast Movement
heresies.description: Demands destruction of all religious imagery and relics

heresies.name: Free Prophet Schism
heresies.description: Anyone may declare prophecy ‚Äî no central authority

heresies.name: Ascetic Revolt
heresies.description: Extreme poverty movement rejecting all temple wealth

heresies.name: Blood Rite Revival
heresies.description: Attempts to revive forbidden sacrificial practices

heresies.name: Wild Faith
heresies.description: Rejects all temples and structure ‚Äî worship only in the untamed wild

heresies.name: Mechanist Doctrine
heresies.description: Claims the divine is a great machine and prayer is merely engineering

heresies.name: Ancestor Revival
heresies.description: Bonesinger rites resurface ‚Äî the dead should guide the living

heresies.name: Void Whisper
heresies.description: Secretive resurgence of Void worship, promising forbidden knowledge

heresies.name: Sun-Moon Schism
heresies.description: Solar Covenant splits over whether the moon is the sun's equal or enemy

heresies.name: Living God Movement
heresies.description: A charismatic preacher claims to be a god incarnate

SHRINE.name: Shrine
SHRINE.description: Small place of worship, spreads faith locally

MONASTERY.name: Monastery
MONASTERY.description: Peaceful retreat, generates karma and faith

CATHEDRAL.name: Cathedral
CATHEDRAL.description: Magnificent cathedral, the pinnacle of religious architecture

ORACLE_TOWER.name: Oracle Tower
ORACLE_TOWER.description: A tower where oracles divine the future through ritual and stargazing

PILGRIM_HOSPICE.name: Pilgrim Hospice
PILGRIM_HOSPICE.description: A waystation offering shelter and healing to pilgrims

SACRED_GROVE.name: Sacred Grove
SACRED_GROVE.description: A consecrated woodland clearing for nature worship

RELIQUARY_VAULT.name: Reliquary Vault
RELIQUARY_VAULT.description: A fortified vault housing powerful religious relics

HEALING.name: Divine Healing
HEALING.description: Invoke divine power to heal all wounds

CONVERSION.name: Mass Conversion
CONVERSION.description: Convert many to your faith at once

HARVEST.name: Bountiful Harvest
HARVEST.effect: All farms produce triple for 3 days
HARVEST.description: Invoke divine fertility upon the land

SMITE.name: Divine Smite
SMITE.effect: Deal massive damage to an enemy unit
SMITE.description: Call down divine wrath upon your enemies

REVELATION.name: Revelation
REVELATION.effect: Reveal all tiles in a large radius
REVELATION.description: The divine grants sight beyond mortal ken

SANCTUARY.name: Holy Sanctuary
SANCTUARY.effect: Create a safe zone where no combat can occur for 5 days
SANCTUARY.description: Consecrate the ground so no blood may be shed upon it

RESURRECTION.name: Resurrection
RESURRECTION.effect: Restore a destroyed unit to full strength
RESURRECTION.description: Call the fallen back from beyond the veil

PLAGUE.name: Divine Plague
PLAGUE.description: Unleash a terrible pestilence upon the unfaithful
